messages.content: You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes many prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and frequently visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I often re-read the medical forms to be sure I am answering them to the best of my ability but I find myself holding back questions for doctors because I don't feel comfortable in my own abilities in sounding educated. I am in constant pain from fibromyalgia and have had difficulty in finding a doctor that won't just give me some pills for depression and send me on my way.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My primary care physician is kind and he listens but I feel he is often in a hurry and hears my words but only the ones that he wants to. He wants to order more test on top of more tests and sends me to other doctors that I can not afford even after I express to him that I do not have the finances to go to others.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I worry that I will be referred to yet another doctor who will then refer me to another doctor. I am also worried that I will be told that the only thing they can do is give me another pill to take.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
My sister was diagnosed with ovarian cancer, stage 3C. I was able to tell her about the different options for treatment.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes few or no prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and rarely visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel that it is very easy for me to get the information I need to understand the health services  and options I am being offered. I have never encountered difficulty understanding what my physician or nurse is saying to me. If I ever need questions answered or clarified I have always received satisfying answers that I can understand.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I have been with my primary physician for years and we have built up a rapport. He has never given me a diagnosis that I felt was wrong to real degree. Even if I did not have my own trusted doctor, I believe that it is in a doctor's best interest to provide the best care possible, so it is easy for me to trust a doctor.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I am always anxious that a problem will be something serious, even though it usually isn't. It is in my ture to prepare for bad news whether it is particularly likely or not.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

A few years ago I was in bed with a fever and heavy fatigue. I had no desire to go to the doctor as I felt that bed rest was the best thing for me and that it was likely viral. After being dragged to the doctor by a loved one, I was sent back home with no medicine and recommended bed rest.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes many prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You engage in little physical activity weekly. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel I know enough to assess my health. I do a lot of research, and I seek info on things I don't understand. Any sudden changes to my help usually prompts a call to my doctor. I have a great doctor; she explains everything in great detail for me. Usually it's no big deal, but she appreciates the concern I have for my health.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My doctor has never been wrong. She has always been honest with me, and she knows when I am not taking my medications like I should. She gets me the results of my blood test back in short order, and changes my prescriptions if I feel they are not working.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

If I am having symptoms that I don't understand, or if I haven't been to the doctor in over a year, I sometimes afraid of what I will find out. It's nothing big, because other than diabetes, nothing really bad has happened to me.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I check my blood sugars daily. My sugars should be below 120. I know when my sugar is high because of the way I feel. I also read literature to determine what level is best for me.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes a moderate number of prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and frequently visits them. You engage in little physical activity weekly.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I feel my ability is at a high degree.  I can understand the health decisions that are given to me and if there are confusing times I'm not afraid to seek help
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
My doctor takes out time to work with me on everything. She recommends services as well as gives me handouts and relates my health to her personal experiences
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I am mostly worried about the findings during exams or test results because I never know what to expect
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
What demonstrated my health is knowing the medical history of my family andv worrying that in some ways I could have the same findings and that's scary

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I completely understand layman terms of health issues however if a terminology is not quite I have and health official nurse or doctor break down anything that needs more understanding or if more specifics are necessary
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
My doctor is pretty clear about his observations and at the same time considerate about my thoughts
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
My anxiety may become an issue when an unknown objective is introduced...ie when an special unknown test is used to provide information
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I am a dietbetic so good measurement is part of my lifestyle to reaching positive health and possibly reducing meds

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes many prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and frequently visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel have the capacity to understand health information and services to a very high degree. I often research health conditions and review information given to me by doctors. I feel is in my best interest to be as well informed as possible in order to make good choices for me and my family.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My primary care doctor had shown diligence in researching ways to help me personally. She knows my conditions and is careful to address all of my concerns. I trust her because she's earned that trust over time.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I feel most anxious about medical exams because I've experienced many life threatening medical issues that have required emergency surgery. I am fearful of death, and also of pain, and having to spend months of recovery. Also the loss of income, and the ability to provide for my family.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I have had an emergency operation to correct a colovescicular fistula, and my recovery took 3 months. I am also a health care professional,  for the last 26 years. During the process I was constantly elevating my wife's level of medical knowledge in order to help her care for me as I went through this situation. My explanation of the medical issues occurring to me also comforted my wife and gave her hope of a good outcome.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I feel I am very capable of making all appropriate decisions. I have been taking Alcatel of not only my self but family and children for over 10 years now.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my primary care doctor. I have been with the same person for 4years and she is very knowledgeable and always on point with treatment and what to do
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I feel anxious or worried when I get blood drawn while being pregnant because there are so many things a child can get. I always worry til the results are in
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I was getting a pap done and was told I had cancer. it was a very difficult time for me to go threw. I was all alone and had Noone to help with the process

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I am very confident in understanding I processing basic health information. There is alot of information to research depending on the ailment I have. This allows me to make the best decisions on the type of services that I need to have.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my doctor because I know that they are working hard to provide the best care possible. There are some money hungry doctors. But as long as I constantly talk to my doctor and they are honest with me then everything will be alright.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
The waiting period in between the examination and diagnosis/treatment. It feels like it takes forever for the doctor to determine the problem.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I had been breastfeeding my son for about 2 months for various reasons. My visit to my obgyn suggested that I get on birth control immediately. It was "breast feeding" friendly. However doing research on the pill I made the decision not to go on that particular birth control.

I think that I have really good access to getting good information on heath by wsy.of doctors snd dentist
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
To a great extent I.do trust doctors a great amount. I think they are smart and very particular about what resources that.they use
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I feel this way about different things that I like to express. I worry about things just like everybody else
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
Im not really sure of a situtation I would put myself in that I could give you a story of that nature

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

Sometimes i have a hard time understanding certain medical procedures or whenever a doctor is explaining things to me. I do ask questions but i do not always understand the answers and sometimes i need help filling out forms because i don't know what to put.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust a doctor because they wouldnt have gotten here if they did not do well in medical school.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
When i feel something is wrong with my body and I'm hoping it is nothing too bad.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
When i had surgery, i had to be in a cast and if i did not take care of myself i would have had to have surgery all over again.

I have minor problems with the bills only. I understand my doctors orders and the importantance of taking all medication on and every day.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my primary care doctor completely because of my time with her. She has gotten my hip replacement done for me.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
This question is not for me. I look forward to going to the doctor's office. There is no problem that makes me feel bad.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I woke one morning feeling odd. There was no reason for this. As i started figuring this out, i came up with chemical imbalance in my head. Doctor agreed.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I understand most information told to me.I pick up things quickly. Don't usually need any help. I hope this answers the question.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
My doctor has taken care of all my family, so he knows our family medical history. I trust his knowledge of medicine to provide the best care possible.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I don't like needles so I get really paranoid of having blood drawn or getting a shot. And the occasionally long wait to get test results back is an uncomfortable time.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I really don't have an experience to talk about here. This question really doesn't pertain to me. So this is not a relevant question for me.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I'm not senile.  I can have a dialog with my doctor at any time I go in for a visit.  I have no one to help me with this.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I have a god relationship with all of my doctors.  They always take as much time with me as necessary
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I am not anxious when I go to the doctor.  They take all the time with me as is necessary and I never feel rushed.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I try to understand everything the doctor says and ask questions if if I do not understand.  The doctor always take the time needed.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes many prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and frequently visits them. You engage in little physical activity weekly.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I am able to obtain, process and understand basic health information which is explained by my doctor or in basic medical reports.  I am unable to understand test results that have shorthand, acronyms etc. that are specific to the medical field.  I do, however ask my doctor to explain any test results or language that I do not undferstand.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My primary care physician is good and better than most.  I believe that, in general doctors have become salesmen.  They are very quick to prescribe medication and refer patients to doctors to patients who refer patients to them.  I do not feel that anyone should completely that in these days of greed and avarice, no one should blindly entrust his/her healthcare to another human being.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I am always afraid that my doctor will find an ailment or serious illness. These worries are exacerbated by the fact that that I am a 65 year old cancer survivor and cancer medication is notorious for causing side effects.  For a while, seemingly, my doctor found some health problem with most visits.  This has made me a little anxious about test results and examinations.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

Breast cancer taught me how little I know about the cancer and its treatments.  I did a lot of research and discovered that there are many treatments and some unscrupulous doctors who will perform unnecessary treatment for financial gain.  This was a rude awakening and I learned from this that my health is my responsibility and that I should be proactive in obtaining information about my medications and conditions.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You have a moderate weekly physical activity.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I have a graduate degree. Although I have never had any medical training, I am familiar with the meanings of many medical terms. I have also studied Latin, and learned the Latin derivation of many terms. I once volunteered in a medical clinic, and learned terminology from a doctor there. He encourage me to go to medical school.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I have certain things in common with my primary care physician. He routinely vacations in an area I am familiar with. My doctor speaks English, and there are no cultural barriers between us. He has a good sense of humor and is, generally speaking, a very nice man. I like him as a person, and I trust his judgment.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

Mostly, it is the fear of the unknown. I have high blood sugar, and I am always concerned that my doctor might tell me that I am a diabetic. That would be very traumatic for me. This relates to my weight, and I worry what my doctor's scale will show for that.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I had never had a urinary tract infection, but I began having unusual symptoms on urination. When I went to the doctor, I suspected that he might test my urine for evidence of infection. He did.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I don't feel as if my best interest is always in mind , I think that the doctor does and give the bare minimum.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
When your health isn't up to par as far as eating well or exercising , or even sickness you never know what to expect.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
Any Time I go to the doctor I very rarely if ever have trouble understanding or answering questions.

I feel that a personal family doctor would be a great help to solving all my questions about my health conditions.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my physician because that is there job unless they want to. Change career paths. But unfortunately that's honestly a doctors duty.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Honestly just the pain that I have to go through is the only things I worry about when I go to the hospital or doctors office.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I had a great experience in my to demonstrate my knowledge of health when I was in the CNA training program and I was answering most of the questions

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes many prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You engage in little physical activity weekly.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I am fully capable to obtain, process, and  understand services needed to make necessary health decisions. I'm very well knowledgeable when it comes to my medical needs.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I been with the same doctor for ten years at least. She and I are not just patient and doctor but true friends. I know she has my best interest.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I feel that everyone gets a little anxious when getting examed. You never know what they're gonna find.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I'm not quite sure what you want. I had a heart attack in 2013. I didn't even think I was having one because the symptoms were different than what they tell you.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes few or no prescription drugs regularly, does not have a primary care physician, and rarely visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I think I have a good ability to make health decisions because I am able to read and understand medical information, as long as it is geared towards the general public. I am generally confident in asking questions of providers if I'm unsure. I have a good grasp of English and try to be prepared to get information when I see a doctor.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I generally trust doctors because it is in their interest to make people feel better, and they have the training to do that. I think it takes a lot of caring for others to be a doctor and most physicians have the patient's best interests at heart. Most of them are proud of what they do and want to do well.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I worry about all the things that could be wrong with me that I didn't notice, but the doctor might find out. These might be expensive to fix, or embarassing, or something that I was foolish not to notice on my own. I might not be in as good of health as I had thought.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

When I received a spider bite from an unknown spider, I knew that I should keep an eye on the bite in case it became serious. I drew a circle around the bite and watched to see if it became bigger. When it did, I went to the doctor and got treatment. I had an infection that was easily treatable.

I feel as though I have the full capacity to fully understand what health literature is presented to me in the hopes of fully understanding my health outcomes.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my doctor because he fully listens to me. I never have a problem with my doctor listening to my worries or health concerns.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
What makes me feel most worried anxious is when my doctor is rushing me to see another pather...this is when he overbooks.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I was diagnosed with diabetes and i had to take metoformin. My A1C was at 6.5. I also had high blood pressure but i do not reme8the meds I was on.
